title: Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologist
description:
SENIOR MARINE TECHNOLOGIST

Chart Your Course With Fleetway Inc...

About Us

With a strong foundation established over 30 years, Fleetway offers a comprehensive capability of engineering, technical, logistics, and management services. We have built an outstanding team of people and partners, invested in the tools, and earned an exemplary track record servicing our customers.

Fleetway’s experience includes project design and development, project implementation, in-service support, and disposal services. Serving commercial and government clients in the marine, naval, oil & gas, and other industrial sectors, we have the people, the credentials, the infrastructure, and the proven track record to provide our customers with the service excellence and value that they are looking for.

We uphold the highest standards of quality, safety and security, and are registered to the ISO 9001:2015 designation.

We are looking for a qualified Sr. Marine Technologist for our Dartmouth, NS office.

Qualifications & Skills:
- Education Required: Associate's Diploma in Engineering Technology with 10 years' experience, QL6B or M Manager certification with Canadian Navy
- Proficient with maintenance procedures and documentation
- Experience in technical writing and proficient with MS Office
- Must have attention to detail and strong organizational skills
- Must be able to meet project deadlines with minimal supervision
- Experience working in a shipyard setting is considered an asset
- Experience in a Quality Assurance Role is considered an asset
- Must be eligible to meet requirements for Canadian government security clearances

Key Responsibilities & Outcomes:
- Reviewing, updating and writing naval system and equipment technical documentation
- Analyzing engineering changes to naval ships/systems/equipment (including structures, materials, welding, paint and preservation, shock and vibration, damage control systems and piping systems) to determine the impact to ship’s systems, equipment and technical documentation
- Providing on-site technical support to customers during the implementation of engineering change installation packages if required
- Working with the Engineering department to identify design issues and potential solutions to engineering changes
- Providing technical input to engineering specifications and drawings
- Conduct technical investigations and engineering studies

What We Offer:
The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary commensurate with skill, ability and experience; along with a comprehensive Total Rewards package including;
- A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan
- Employee & Family Assistance Programs
- RRSP matching program
- Flexible work hours
- Hybrid work arrangements
- Health & wellness reimbursements
- Opportunities to take part in job related training and individual development plans
- Growth and progression opportunities within Fleetway and the larger network of the J.D. Irving group of companies
- Business casual work environment, with casual Friday’s
Additionally, in your covering letter, we ask if you could identify how your work background and experience aligns with the job profile and requirements.

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.
To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please complete the online application form. An up-to-date resume showing experience and education is required. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

To learn more about our products and services, click here.



Fleetway Inc. is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees. Fleetway Inc. is committed to providing an accessible organization by removing barriers for people with disabilities.

We do not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Fuel Transfer Attendant (Graham Marine)
description:
Graham Marine Services LTD is looking for a full time attendant at our Legacy Fuel Barge in Coal Harbour. The ideal candidate will be safety oriented and have great customer service skills.

The position will require some weekend and evening work. The Fuel Barge is in Vancouver Harbour and does require the candidate to operate our workboat to go to and from the barge. Training will be provided

Duties will involve supervising fuel transfers to our commercial and recreational customers. Experience in transfering fuel is an assett but not required as all training will be provided. No phone calls please and any short listed applicants will be contacted for an interview

Value

title: Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologist
description:
SR. MARINE MECHANICAL TECHNOLOGIST - OTTAWA, ON

We Are Fleetway!

We believe Canada’s maritime fleets need to be reliable and fit for purpose, with crews that are fully trained and supported. We work as a trusted technical partner during design, construction, in-service, and end of life. We are proud to deliver quality professional technical services including Engineering, Integrated Logistics Support, Technical Editing, Configuration Management, Project Management, Training, Technical Translation, and Marine Technical Services.

Over the past 35+ years, we have built an outstanding team of people and partners, invested in the tools, and earned an exemplary track record servicing our customers. Everything we do is aimed at developing our people and improving our use of innovation to be the leading professional services provider in the marine industry.

We uphold the highest standards of quality, safety and security, and are registered to the ISO 9001:2015, and ISO 14001 designations.

If this sounds like a team you'd like to be a part of and make a difference with, then we'd love to hear from you!

As one of Canada's largest marine engineering integrators, we are looking for talented individuals to bring their skills to Fleetway as we lead the way in Canadian naval defence contracts (In Service Support). Our work is project focused on government ship design and support, including warships, ferries, ice-breakers and commercial vessels. We are looking for a qualified Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologist to join our Ottawa, ON office.

Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologists are a vital asset to the Marine Technical Services team who reviews and analyzes engineering changes to determine the impact on naval ships and related documentation. This position is primarily office-based however there may be requirements to provide on-site technical support to customers to ensure proper implementation of engineering change installation packages.

Fleetway is committed to the principle of employment equity and strives to provide an environment where all employees feel supported, valued, and free from discrimination and harassment. We encourage applications from qualified African Canadians and other Racially Visible Persons, Women, Persons with Disabilities, Aboriginal persons and persons of the LGBTQ2S+ community. Fleetway is committed to providing an accessible organization by removing barriers for people with disabilities.

Key Responsibilities & Outcomes:
- Reviewing, updating and writing naval system and equipment technical documentation
- Analyzing engineering changes to naval ships/systems/equipment (including structures, materials, welding, paint and preservation, shock and vibration, damage control systems and piping systems) to determine the impact to ship’s systems, equipment and technical documentation
- Providing technical input to engineering specifications and drawings
- Conduct technical investigations and engineering studies

Skill, Capabilities, and Experience:
- Education Required: Associate's Diploma in Engineering Technology with 10 years' experience or MARTECH Tech PO1 Maint Manager certification from Canadian Navy
- Proficient with maintenance procedures and documentation
- Experience in technical writing and proficient with MS Office
- Must have attention to detail and strong organizational skills
- Must be able to meet project deadlines with minimal supervision
- Experience working in a shipyard setting is considered an asset
- Experience in a Quality Assurance Role is considered an asset
All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance

What We Offer:
The successful candidate will receive a starting salary based on their applicable experience and demonstrated knowledge, skill and abilities. Additionally, we offer the following:
- We are regularly adding new departments, positions, and functions within Fleetway, as such we can offer you growth and development opportunities for future career advancement
- We provide direct support to your training and development plans, including support towards your professional certifications, memberships, or designations
- Flexible work hours (core hours)
- Hybrid work arrangements
- We have Mental Health first aid trained staff in all offices, and an ongoing subscription to the Not Myself Today mental health program
- A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan, with an enhanced focus on mental health and wellness
- Ability to save for your future with our company matching RRSP program
- 15-week maternity leave top-up program
- Employee & Family Assistance Program
- Annual health & wellness reimbursements
- Business casual work environment, with casual Friday’s
- A slick company jacket that will definitely make you the envy of your friends

To Apply for this Career Opportunity: 
Please complete the online application form.  A current resume of past experience and education is required.
 
All applications will be reviewed by one of our recruiters.  If the recruiter sees a potential opportunity (current or future) that matches your skills and experience, you will be contacted to discuss your qualifications for a position with Fleetway. 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  

To learn more about our products and services, click here.




We do not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologist
description:
SR. MARINE TECHNOLOGIST
LEVIS, QUEBEC
- Marine Electrical
- Marine Mechanical
- Hull
- Combat Systems

About Us

Fleetway is a recognized industry leader in marine engineering, technical, logistics and management services. We have built an outstanding team of people, and partners, invested in the right tools and earned an exemplary track record providing service to our customers.

We are now in an important stage in our growth and are looking for talented individuals to bring skills and abilities to one of Canada's largest marine engineering integrators as we lead the way in Canadian naval defence contracts (In Service Support) and new government ship design and support, including warships, ferries, ice-breakers and commercial vessels.

We are looking for a qualified Marine Technologist for a full-time permanent role located in Levis, Quebec. The successful candidate will be a resident of a nearby city in Quebec, willing to relocate to the area OR commute between the locations.

The Marine (Naval) Technologist is a vital asset to the Marine Technical Services team who reviews and analyzes engineering changes to determine the impact on naval ships and related documentation, as well as provides on-site technical support to customers to ensure proper implementation of engineering change installation packages.

Qualifications:
- Education Required: 3-Year College Diploma in relevant field OR QL6 qualification (or above) from the RCN
- Years of Experience Required: 10+ years of Canadian Naval experience as a Marine Technologist (Electrical, CSE, Hull, Mechanical)
- Bilingual- English and French required
- Ability to work independently in a shipyard setting required
- Experience in technical writing and proficient with MS Office
- Must have attention to detail and strong organizational skills and be motivated meet project deadlines with minimal supervision
- Seasoned understanding of the interaction of all disciplines (steel, structural, mechanical, electrical, electronic, etc)
- Must be eligible to meet requirements for Canadian government security clearance

Key Responsibilities:

- Perform on-site technical support, troubleshoot and be able to conduct QA/QC inspections and investigations related to various tasks
- Able to produce concise technical reports including conducting research of technical documentation, drawings, specifications relative to task at hand
- Strong, precise communication skills to stakeholders- keep everyone in the loop!
- Ability to inspect work in accordance with supplied inspection guidelines and provide support as needed to existing team of inspectors

What We Offer:

The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary commensurate with skill, ability and experience, along with a comprehensive package including:
- Health and wellness benefits (including Fitness Reimbursement)
- Flexible work hours
- Enrollment in company RRSP matching program

To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please apply online as soon as possible.

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


TECHNOLOGUE MARITIME SÉNIOR
LÉVIS, QUÉBEC
- Systèmes électriques
- Systèmes mécaniques
- Systèmes de la coque
- Systèmes de combat

À propos de nous
Fleetway est un chef de file dans le domaine des services d'ingénierie maritime, des services techniques et des services de logistique et de gestion. Nous avons bâti une équipe exceptionnelle, investi dans les bons outils et acquis une expérience exemplaire en matière de service à nos clients.
Nous entamons présentement dans une étape importante de notre croissance et recherchons des professionnels talentueux qui apporterons compétences et capacités à l'un des plus grands intégrateurs en génie maritime du Canada. Nous ouvrons présentement la voie dans des contrats de soutien en service pour la Marine Royale Canadienne et des contrats de conception de nouveaux navires de guerre, des traversiers, des brise-glaces et des navires commerciaux.
Nous recherchons un technologue maritime qualifié afin de combler un poste permanent à temps plein situé à Lévis, Québec. Le candidat retenu sera un résident d'une ville voisine au Québec, disposé à déménager dans la région OU à faire la navette entre les emplacements.
Le technologue maritime sera un atout essentiel au sein l'équipe des services techniques maritimes qui examine et analyse les changements d'ingénierie afin d’en déterminer l'impact sur les navires de guerre et leur documentation technique. Il fournira ainsi à nos clients un soutien technique sur place afin d’assurer la bonne mise en œuvre des devis d’ingénierie.
Qualifications:
Formation requise: diplôme d'études collégiales de 3 ans dans un domaine pertinent (énuméré ci-dessus) OU qualification technique QL6 au sein de la Marine Royale Canadienne (MRC).
- Années d'expérience requises: plus d’une dizaine d’années d'expérience dans la MRC en tant que technologue maritime (système électrique, système de combat, système de la coque, système mécanique)
- Bilingue – anglais et français requis
- Capacité à travailler de manière autonome dans un chantier naval
- Expérience en rédaction technique et maîtrise de la suite de produits MS Office
- Doit avoir le souci du détail et de solides compétences organisationnelles et être motivé par le respect des délais des projets, et ce, avec un minimum de supervision
- Compréhension avancée de l'interaction de toutes les disciplines (acier, structure, mécanique, électrique, électronique, etc.)
- Doit être admissible à satisfaire aux exigences d'octroi d’une attestation de sécurité du gouvernement canadien
Principales responsabilités:
- Assurer un support technique sur site, dépanner et être en mesure de mener des inspections et des enquêtes AQ / CQ liées à diverses tâches
- Production de rapports techniques concis, y compris la recherche de documentation technique, de dessins et de spécifications relatives à la tâche à accomplir
- Assurer une communication constante avec les parties prenantes - tenir tout le monde au courant!
- Inspecter les travaux conformément aux directives d'inspection fournies et fournir un soutien à l'équipe d'inspecteurs existante lorsque requis
Ce que nous offrons:
Le candidat retenu recevra un salaire compétitif à la mesure de ses compétences, de ses capacités et de son expérience, ainsi que d'un ensemble complet d’avantages sociaux comprenant:
- Avantages pour la santé et le bien-être (y compris le remboursement de la condition physique)
- Heures de travail flexibles
- Inscription au programme de contrepartie REER d'entreprise
Pour postuler à cette opportunité de carrière:
- Veuillez postuler en ligne dès que possible.
REMARQUE: Le recruteur examine et interview les candidats éligibles pour ce poste au fur et à mesure qu'ils sont reçus. Si vous êtes intéressé par cette publication, nous vous encourageons à postuler dès que possible.
Nous apprécions votre intérêt pour notre entreprise! Seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.

title: Sr. Marine Mechanical Technologist
description:
SR. MARINE TECHNOLOGIST

LEVIS, QUEBEC
  • Marine Electrical
  • Marine Mechanical
  • Hull
  • Combat Systems
About Us

Fleetway is a recognized industry leader in marine engineering, technical, logistics and management services. We have built an outstanding team of people, and partners, invested in the right tools and earned an exemplary track record providing service to our customers.

We are now in an important stage in our growth and are looking for talented individuals to bring skills and abilities to one of Canada's largest marine engineering integrators as we lead the way in Canadian naval defence contracts (In Service Support) and new government ship design and support, including warships, ferries, ice-breakers and commercial vessels.

We are looking for a qualified Marine Technologist for a full-time permanent role located in Levis, Quebec. The successful candidate will be a resident of a nearby city in Quebec, willing to relocate to the area OR commute between the locations.

The Marine (Naval) Technologist is a vital asset to the Marine Technical Services team who reviews and analyzes engineering changes to determine the impact on naval ships and related documentation, as well as provides on-site technical support to customers to ensure proper implementation of engineering change installation packages.

Qualifications
  • Education Required: 3-Year College Diploma in relevant field OR QL6 qualification (or above) from the RCN
  • Years of Experience Required: 10+ years of Canadian Naval experience as a Marine Technologist (Electrical, CSE, Hull, Mechanical)
  • Bilingual- English and French required
  • Ability to work independently in a shipyard setting required
  • Experience in technical writing and proficient with MS Office
  • Must have attention to detail and strong organizational skills and be motivated meet project deadlines with minimal supervision
  • Seasoned understanding of the interaction of all disciplines (steel, structural, mechanical, electrical, electronic, etc)
  • Must be eligible to meet requirements for Canadian government security clearance
Key Responsibilities
  • Perform on-site technical support, troubleshoot and be able to conduct QA/QC inspections and investigations related to various tasks
  • Able to produce concise technical reports including conducting research of technical documentation, drawings, specifications relative to task at hand
  • Strong, precise communication skills to stakeholders- keep everyone in the loop!
  • Ability to inspect work in accordance with supplied inspection guidelines and provide support as needed to existing team of inspectors
What We Offer

The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary commensurate with skill, ability and experience, along with a comprehensive package including:
  • Health and wellness benefits (including Fitness Reimbursement)
  • Flexible work hours
  • Enrollment in company RRSP matching program
To Apply For This Career Opportunity

Please apply online as soon as possible.

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

TECHNOLOGUE MARITIME SÉNIOR

LÉVIS, QUÉBEC
  • Systèmes électriques
  • Systèmes mécaniques
  • Systèmes de la coque
  • Systèmes de combat
À propos de nous

Fleetway est un chef de file dans le domaine des services d'ingénierie maritime, des services techniques et des services de logistique et de gestion. Nous avons bâti une équipe exceptionnelle, investi dans les bons outils et acquis une expérience exemplaire en matière de service à nos clients.

Nous entamons présentement dans une étape importante de notre croissance et recherchons des professionnels talentueux qui apporterons compétences et capacités à l'un des plus grands intégrateurs en génie maritime du Canada. Nous ouvrons présentement la voie dans des contrats de soutien en service pour la Marine Royale Canadienne et des contrats de conception de nouveaux navires de guerre, des traversiers, des brise-glaces et des navires commerciaux.

Nous recherchons un technologue maritime qualifié afin de combler un poste permanent à temps plein situé à Lévis, Québec. Le candidat retenu sera un résident d'une ville voisine au Québec, disposé à déménager dans la région OU à faire la navette entre les emplacements.

Le technologue maritime sera un atout essentiel au sein l'équipe des services techniques maritimes qui examine et analyse les changements d'ingénierie afin d’en déterminer l'impact sur les navires de guerre et leur documentation technique. Il fournira ainsi à nos clients un soutien technique sur place afin d’assurer la bonne mise en œuvre des devis d’ingénierie.

Qualifications

Formation requise: diplôme d'études collégiales de 3 ans dans un domaine pertinent (énuméré ci-dessus) OU qualification technique QL6 au sein de la Marine Royale Canadienne (MRC).
  • Années d'expérience requises: plus d’une dizaine d’années d'expérience dans la MRC en tant que technologue maritime (système électrique, système de combat, système de la coque, système mécanique)
  • Bilingue – anglais et français requis
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome dans un chantier naval
  • Expérience en rédaction technique et maîtrise de la suite de produits MS Office
  • Doit avoir le souci du détail et de solides compétences organisationnelles et être motivé par le respect des délais des projets, et ce, avec un minimum de supervision
  • Compréhension avancée de l'interaction de toutes les disciplines (acier, structure, mécanique, électrique, électronique, etc.)
  • Doit être admissible à satisfaire aux exigences d'octroi d’une attestation de sécurité du gouvernement canadien
Principales Responsabilités
  • Assurer un support technique sur site, dépanner et être en mesure de mener des inspections et des enquêtes AQ / CQ liées à diverses tâches
  • Production de rapports techniques concis, y compris la recherche de documentation technique, de dessins et de spécifications relatives à la tâche à accomplir
  • Assurer une communication constante avec les parties prenantes - tenir tout le monde au courant!
  • Inspecter les travaux conformément aux directives d'inspection fournies et fournir un soutien à l'équipe d'inspecteurs existante lorsque requis
Ce Que Nous Offrons

Le candidat retenu recevra un salaire compétitif à la mesure de ses compétences, de ses capacités et de son expérience, ainsi que d'un ensemble complet d’avantages sociaux comprenant:
  • Avantages pour la santé et le bien-être (y compris le remboursement de la condition physique)
  • Heures de travail flexibles
  • Inscription au programme de contrepartie REER d'entreprise
Pour Postuler à Cette Opportunité De Carrière
  • Veuillez postuler en ligne dès que possible.
REMARQUE: Le recruteur examine et interview les candidats éligibles pour ce poste au fur et à mesure qu'ils sont reçus. Si vous êtes intéressé par cette publication, nous vous encourageons à postuler dès que possible.

Nous apprécions votre intérêt pour notre entreprise! Seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.

To learn more about our products and services, click here.

Fleetway Inc. is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees. Fleetway Inc. is committed to providing an accessible organization by removing barriers for people with disabilities.

We do not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Marine Structural Engineer
description:
Advisian is the independent consulting business line of Worley providing solutions for clients in the Hydrocarbons, Minerals & Metals, Chemicals and Infrastructure industries. We have combined the deep technical consulting capabilities of Worley Consulting, Select and INTECSEA with our existing strategy and management consulting expertise. As part of one of the world’s largest engineering firms, we continue to push boundaries and extend our capabilities globally. Worley is a company that prides itself on providing safe and high-quality services that exceed our customer’s expectations, which is why we manage some of the world's leading projects. Our aim is to recruit, develop, and most importantly, retain the people who share our vision and strategy.

Purpose

We are currently looking for a Senior Marine Structural Engineer to join our Advisian team in Vancouver, BC.

Responsibilities
  • Lead team(s) in the design of marine structures including docks, marinas, ports, ferry terminals, peirs, steel sheet pile structures, steel and timber pile structures, floating structures and waterfront facilities
  • Undertake, supervise and provide technical mentorship on analysis, modelling, reports, design and drawings for marine structural engineering design
  • Oversee preparation of quantity take-offs and assist in the preparation of capital cost estimates
  • Monitor construction progress through site visits and meetings with clients and contractors
  • Develop criteria and construction specifications
  • Manage structural engineering services such as:
    • participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and comply with required checking procedures
    • ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes
    • provide advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. For example, oversee requisitions, technical bid evaluations and purchase order preparation
  • Act as the structural engineering Lead on specific projects
  • If required, assist and support junior personnel within the structural engineering team
What You Will Bring

Technical and Industry Experience
  • Minimum 20 years of experience in marine structural engineering/research, or related discipline
  • Excellent knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the structural engineering, and the basic requirements of other engineering fields
  • Excellent knowledge of applicable local and international standards and statutory and regulatory specifications
  • Competent use of relevant software such as MS Office Suite and structural engineering specific software
Required

Education – Qualifications, Accreditation, Training
  • Civil Engineering degree
  • Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status
Our goal is to develop and most importantly retain the people who share our vision and strategy. To help us achieve our vision and yours, apply now.

Company

Worley

Primary Location

CAN-BC-Vancouver

Job

Structural

Schedule

Full-time

Employment Type

Employee

Job Level

Experienced

Job Posting

Feb 23, 2022

Unposting Date

May 26, 2022

Reporting Manager Title

Marine Lead

title: Customer Service Representative (Lions Gate Marine Centre)
description:
Customer Service Representative - Full-Time Role

Working at Lions Gate Marine Centre puts you at the centre of a North Vancouver’s bustling waterfront. As a full-service marine centre and dry boat storage centre, no two days are alike and that means interesting, diverse, and challenging work. If you are a self-starter looking for employment that offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, we invite you to dive in and explore the possibilities. We also offer on the job training lots of opportunity to grow.

Lions Gate Marine Centre is seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our team.

Responsibilities
  • Respond to inquiries (in person, phone, email) in a professional and timely manner.
  • Understand customer needs and proactively advise on suitable marine centre solutions.
  • Proactively selling the services of the marine centre.
  • Effectively and efficiently schedule services (boat launches, lifts, forklift assistance)
  • Communicate and work with the marina yard staff to ensure smooth delivery of services.
  • Maintain and update client records and data.
  • Perform end of day closing activities.
  • Prepare invoices and statements, and process payments.
  • Process storage and work yard move-ins, move-outs, and transfers. Monitoring overall storage availability.
  • Assist with inventory tracking and monitoring deliveries.
  • Sort and routes incoming office mail, internal and external, and provides timely distribution of all incoming communication.
  • Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications
  • High school diploma or post-secondary diploma
  • 1 year of office or customer service experience
  • Solid computer skills and ability to learn new software
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to work well under limited supervision
  • Having some knowledge of boats is an asset
Schedule

Monday to Sunday and may included evenings during the high season

40 hours per week

To apply, please send both a Resume and Cover Letter to joinus@lionsgatemarina.com and specify the position you are applying for in the subject heading.

Value

title: Senior Mechanical Naval Design Engineer
description:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for a Senior Mechanical Naval Design Engineer for our Satellite Systems team at our Montreal office.

Role

As the leading global independent commercial supplier of antennas, payloads, and electronics for communication and radar satellites, our team has successfully contributed to hundreds of missions in the past 60 years. With an extensive heritage in a wide range of solutions delivered to customers globally, our Satellite Systems team continues to grow and evolve on the ground and in the stars. As our Senior Naval Mechanical Engineer you will:
  • Establish the naval mechanical design of antennas and electronic equipment,
  • Interface with the multi-disciplinary engineering design team (electrical, materials, quality assurance, etc.) to ensure mechanical design aligns with other requirements,
  • Prepare the required documentation to support production definition,
  • Interface with the customer (statements of compliance, interface definition, design reviews),
  • Define subsystem mechanical requirements,
  • Interact with suppliers & review the mechanical worthiness & compliance of their designs,
  • Conduct analytical & environmental studies,
  • Establish test plans & procedures,
  • Prepare technical reports for use by engineering & management.
Responsibilities
  • A bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering with 10 to 15 years of experience in military/naval programs.
  • Must be familiar with standards used in the industry, notably the following specification documents: Def Stan 00-35; MIL-HDBK-310; MIL-STD-810G; Def Stan 07-247; Def Stan 08-144; MAP 01-470; MIL-S-901; MIL-STD-1472G; MIL-STD-167-1A; MIL-STD-882E
  • Dynamic.
  • Previous design experience with naval or other military radar antenna programs.
  • Familiarity with requirements management and traceability tools (ex: DOORS)
  • Familiarity with mechanical design aspects of high power RF systems and related support subsystems (power, cooling, etc.)
  • Proven problem solving abilities,
  • Demonstrated leadership,
  • Multi-tasking abilities,
  • Capable to set priorities, manage schedules & cost aspects,
  • Bilingual preferred.
#IND1

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

Comments/Special Considerations

Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

COVID-19 Hiring Update

Strengthening our workforce is more important than ever to meet our customers’ mission-critical needs. We are continuing to hire many talented people, and we are closely monitoring COVID-19 to ensure safe hiring practices are used. This includes limiting onsite candidate interviews and prioritizing video interviews.

Vaccine Policy

With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

title: Marine Systems Engineering
company: Canadian Armed Forces | Forces armées canadiennes
description:
Opportunity

Do you love travelling and being in the outdoors? Are you looking for a rewarding role in leadership? A career as a Marine Systems Engineer in the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) provides the opportunity to provide expertise and management on new equipment and provide training to a team.

 

Overview
Marine Systems Engineers within the CAF are responsible for the readiness, operation and maintenance of propulsion and ancillary systems, power generation and distribution, auxiliary systems, ship’s service systems, ship and machinery control systems, hull structure, ship’s stability, damage control, and the integration of these systems.

 

They analyze the state of their systems, equipment and personnel, predict their requirement for naval operations and advise Command accordingly. The primary role of a Marine Systems Engineer is to provide technical expertise, advice and leadership in support of:

 

●     Day-to-day naval operations and maintenance of marine systems in ships and submarines

●     The continuous renewal of the Fleet through modernization and replacement of naval marine systems and equipment, including:

○     Design

○     Development

○     Acquisition

○     Construction

○     Disposal

●     Maintenance of infrastructure needed to support naval operations and missions in times of emergency, mobilization and war

 

Eligibility

To be eligible to apply to the CAF, you must:

●     be a Canadian citizen;

●     be at least 18 years old (17 years old with parental consent), except:

o   For the Regular Force Paid Education programs—you may be 16 years old (with parental consent);

o   For the Primary Reserves—you may be 16 years old (with parental consent) and must be enrolled as a full-time student; and

●     have completed at least Grade 10 or Secondaire IV in Québec (some jobs need higher levels of education).

 

 

 

Related civilian occupations

Although this occupation has no direct related civilian job, the experience, skills and leadership abilities developed in this position are highly valued by employers.

Basic Military Officer Qualification
After enrolment, you start basic officer training at the Canadian Forces Leadership and Recruit School in Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu, Quebec, for 12 weeks. Topics covered include general military knowledge, the principles of leadership, regulations and customs of the Forces, basic weapons handling, and first aid. Opportunities will also be provided to apply such newly acquired military skills in training exercises involving force protection, field training, navigation and leadership. A rigorous physical fitness program is also a vital part of basic training. Basic officer training is provided in both Canadian official languages (English or French) with successful completion being a prerequisite for further military training.

Following basic officer training, official second language training may be offered to you. Training could take from two to nine months to complete depending on your ability in your second language.

Naval Officer Training

All officer candidates in the Navy attend a nine-week Naval Environmental Training Program held at the Naval Officer Training Centre in Victoria, British Columbia. This course introduces the naval environment and includes four weeks on board a minor war vessel for officers to experience life at sea.

 

Specialty Training

Marine Systems Engineers who demonstrate the required ability and potential will be offered specialized training in the following fields:

●     Marine propulsion control system analysis

●     Cargo management

●     Vibration analysis

●     Gas turbine engineering

●     Reliability centered maintenance

●     Advanced ship production

 

Advanced Training

Marine Systems Engineering may also be offered the opportunity to further enhance their engineering credentials through fully funded post-graduate education in Canada or abroad, in the following fields:

●     Naval architecture

●     Marine engineering

●     Heavy electrical engineering

●     Control and instrumentation engineering

 

 

 

Paid Education

Due to the requirement for Regular Force CAF officers to obtain a university degree, the CAF will pay successful recruits to complete a bachelor degree program in the Royal Military College System. Recruits will receive full-time salary including medical and dental care, as well as vacation time with full pay in exchange for working in the CAF for a period of time. Typically, candidates enter the Canadian Military College System as an Officer Cadet where they study subjects relevant to both their military and academic career. In rare instances, based on the needs of the CAF, candidates may be approved attend another Canadian University. A determination will be made on a case by case basis. If you are interested in applying for this program, you must apply to the CAF. It is highly recommended to apply to other Canadian universities of your choice should you not be accepted for a Regular Officer Training Plan (ROTP) option.

 

Direct Entry

If you already have a university degree, the CAF will decide if your academic program matches the criteria for this job and may place you directly into the required on-the-job training program following basic training. Basic training and military officer qualification training are required before being assigned.

 

Join the CAF

To learn more about becoming a Marine Systems Engineering Officer, visit www.forces.ca, talk to a recruiter at a centre nearest you or, call 1-800-856-8488.

 

Discover over 100 different career opportunities at www.forces.ca.

title: Marine Plant Administrator
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener , smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

Overview

The Marine Plant Administrator will join a high performing team and be a key contributor to the success of the Greater Vancouver Aggregates group. The Lafarge Marine Division provides tug and barge services to internal and external customers in the Greater Vancouver Area and Pacific Northwest.

The Marine Plant Administrator is a key member of the team; supporting tracking and payment of vendor invoicing, payroll and expense administration, data management for operational and maintenance KPIs, Work Order administration, maintaining and updating crew and vessel certifications and reporting.

The primary objectives of this role are to achieve efficiencies of operations and other critical revenue objectives for the market area while ensuring our offering promotes safety, service and value for our customers. The Marine Plant Administrator will work closely with all members of the Marine management team.

This role may involve occasional after-hours phone calls as operational demand or customer needs arise.

Responsibilities

 Health & Safety
  • Demonstrates a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to safety policies in all work environment areas.
  • Participates in job observations and toolbox talks as required.
  • Maintains documentation on safety drills, exercises, tool box talks and training for Lafarge and Transport Canada reporting requirements.
Vendor Management Support
  • Receive invoices against Purchase Orders
  • Create new vendor requests and maintain existing vendor records.
  • Ensure vendors meet applicable Lafarge policies before requesting Purchase orders.
  • Resolve supplier invoice discrepancies between supplier and Financial Services Center.
  • Create purchase orders and receiving records for Ariba system purchases.
Financial Support
  • Maintain crew payroll files preparing balances for bi-weekly pay cycle
  • Assist with tracking P-Card and T&E expenses. Create applicable expense reports as required.
  • Allocate and reconcile fuel consumption to all site specific equipment.
Certificate Management
  • Maintain crew certificate database to track tickets and expiry dates
  • Maintain vessel certificate database to track applicable documentation and expiry dates
  • Maintain annual Transport Canada vessel certificates (e.g. bunker, wreck, blue cards)
Maintenance Support
  • Maintain consistent tracking of equipment hours for preventative maintenance processes
  • Track work orders for costing purposes and provide information to management.
  • Assist Maintenance Manager as required (e.g. to issue equipment maintenance notifications and work orders) to ensure preventative maintenance KPI’s are met.
Reporting And Data Entry
  • Maintain data for operational spend items (e.g. grub) and crew overtime
  • Create sea time reports for crew as requested
  • Ad hoc reporting as per direction of Senior Manager
SAP access
  • Procure to Pay (P2P)
  • Plant Maintenance (PM)
Relationships With Other Jobs
  • Reports to the Senior Manager, Marine Division
  • Daily interaction with Marine management team (Scheduler, Finance Analyst, Maintenance Manager, Dispatch)
  • Regular interaction with Aggregate team, vendor team, billing and invoicing
Qualifications
  • A post-secondary education is required, preferably with an Accounting Diploma or other Business Administration background.
  • 1-3 years of accounting experience is preferred in addition to other relevant construction materials experience.
  • Advanced Excel Skills
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Works well in a team environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Organized self-starter

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate , driven by curiosity and keen to grow , learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers .

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Marine Charterer
description:
Job Title

Marine Charterer

Who are we?

Founded in 1924, Irving Oil is a family-owned international refining and marketing company with a history of long-term partnerships and relationships. With operations throughout Eastern Canada, New England and Ireland we focus on delivering quality products and exceptional service to our customers and our communities. Every day, we strive to put our good energy in action to bring families together, support the environment and local wildlife, and to create learning opportunities that empower the next generation.

Here's What You Can Expect From Us

When you're a part of our team, you'll see how we bring good energy to all that we do. At Irving Oil, we strive for a work environment where each of us feels we belong, can bring our whole selves to work, and where we treat our fellow employees with kindness and respect. Together, we will support our corporate strategy, high standards and the communities where we live and work. Our collaborative approach, safety-first culture and commitment to building resilient teams helps reinforce our internal brand position where People Matter. That's why we're dedicated to investing in our employees’ potential, so that they can reach their career goals.

Job Description

What you can expect in a typical day

We are looking for a Marine Charterer to ensure that appropriate vessels are chartered to meet the demands of our complex supply chain and keep our products moving. You will be responsible for chartering requirements on ships and barges including Foreign Flag, Canadian Flag, and American Flag. This includes chartering at the best possible transportation costs, management of vessel performance, and ensuring minimal risk to the company in terms of safety, reliability, financial, and meeting customer delivery expectations.

Responsibilities
  • Perform daily chartering activities for time or spot charter vessels. Coordinate delivery and redelivery notices, invoice approvals, as well as review and negotiate any post fixtures requests.
  • Work with Marine Operations to ensure the assessment and checking of claims from owners and brokers for demurrages, detention, and deviation within the terms of the charter party is done in a timely manner to negotiate prompt settlement.
  • Provide recommendations for maximizing fleet revenue and profits on spot chartered vessels.
  • Understanding of charter party terms and conditions to negotiate with Owners directly or via brokers; work towards low transportation costs per barrel (Bbl) to the company.
  • Design and execution of chartering strategies including minimizing risk exposure in schedule reliability, pollution exposure, and meeting customer delivery windows.
  • Continuously review market conditions; evaluate and recommend candidate ships and barges by considering multiple factors.
  • Coordinate with marine operations to ensure the relevant charter party terms and conditions and voyage specifics are understood by all stakeholders.
  • Support the team on the assessment and verification of claims from owners and brokers for demurrage, detention, and deviation from the terms of the charter party.
  • Provide recommendations for minimizing costs and maximizing margins.
  • Conduct analysis on chartered vessels; ensure compliance to agreed speed and consumption, that they have sufficient bunkers on board and correct controls are in place to allow the required quality of bunkers to be delivered.
  • Review non-compliance situations: ensure owners are placed on notice and lost costs are claimed back.
  • Complete monthly, quarterly, yearly, and other ad hoc reporting; manage applicable KPIs and provide shipping budget data as requested.
  • Produce market-based freight forecasts as required.
What You’ll Need To Succeed
  • Ability and willingness to learn.
  • Strategic mindset to understand all of the nuances and complexities of the global freight market, company standards and policies, sanction polices, and how these impact our business.
  • Knowledgeable about risks for ships in different geographic areas.
  • Strong negotiation skills.
  • Able to produce clear reports with accurate data including reports on market conditions.
  • Knowledge of marine claim procedures and settlements.
  • Financial analysis skills and acumen.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; proactive in identifying and communicating potential issues.
  • Thrive working in an ever changing, dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Able to work outside a regular office schedule as required; this is critical due to the nature of our business.
Travel
  • Occasional travel is required within our global operating areas.
Education And Experience
  • Post-secondary education in business, a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in ship chartering.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in operations.
  • Strong computer skills.
Irving Oil supports a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants.

Job Requirements - Work Experience

Chartering

Job Requirements - Education

Diploma / Certification: Business Administration

Location

Saint John, NB

title: Marine Scheduler (Hybrid Opportunity)
description:
Job Title

Marine Scheduler (Hybrid Opportunity)

Who are we?

Founded in 1924, Irving Oil is a family-owned international refining and marketing company with a history of long-term partnerships and relationships. With operations throughout Eastern Canada, New England and Ireland we focus on delivering quality products and exceptional service to our customers and our communities. Every day, we strive to put our good energy in action to bring families together, support the environment and local wildlife, and to create learning opportunities that empower the next generation.

Here's What You Can Expect From Us

When you're a part of our team, you'll see how we bring good energy to all that we do. At Irving Oil, we strive for a work environment where each of us feels we belong, can bring our whole selves to work, and where we treat our fellow employees with kindness and respect. Together, we will support our corporate strategy, high standards and the communities where we live and work. Our collaborative approach, safety-first culture and commitment to building resilient teams helps reinforce our internal brand position where People Matter. That's why we're dedicated to investing in our employees’ potential, so that they can reach their career goals.

Job Description

What you can expect in a typical day

We are currently looking for a Marine Scheduler to join our Marine Logistics team in Saint John, NB. As a Marine Scheduler, you are an integral contributor to the success of the supply chain. The Marine Scheduler is responsible for voyage planning and the coordination of marine movements across our supply chain. This is achieved through the development of monthly shipping plans in collaboration with a variety of supply chain stakeholders to execute and expedite those plans. The Marine Scheduler is focused on minimizing the overall marine cost per barrel to the organization through continuous efforts to optimize the marine schedule, expedite all marine movements day to day and minimize or eliminate ship delays.

What We Offer
  • Competitive salary, bonus and pension plan
  • Flexible benefits, including a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible work program
  • Wellness support, including annual wellness allowance and paid personal care days
  • Paid vacation and vacation purchasing
  • Personal and professional development opportunities
  • Named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for six consecutive years
Your Roles And Responsibilities
  • Development of Monthly Product Lifting Schedules
  • Daily communication and collaboration with various supply chain stakeholders on schedule updates and vessel ETAs.
  • Leverage trusting relationship with supply chain stakeholders to identify and implement creative solutions to issues.
  • Proactively monitor and identify incremental vessel(s) to maintain integrity of the shipping program.
  • Monitor and safely expedite all aspect of vessel movements through effective communications with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
  • Deliver on budget costs through effective management of assets.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external counterparts at all facilities.
  • Perform “on-call” duties as required.
  • Perform any other assigned or requested activities necessary to maintain or promote departmental productivity.
  • Coordinate inspection services on cargos (Gauging, testing and additives).
What You’ll Need To Succeed
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Team player with strong communication, decision making, and collaboration skills
  • Ability to make focused, quick decisions and perform under pressure
  • Strong analytical skills and able to solve problems.
  • Proven ability to build strong relationships, both internal and external.
  • Highly motivated & self-driven
  • Must possess strong attention to detail
  • Proficient using MS Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Excel
  • Thrive on working in a high-pressure environment with tight deadlines.
Travel
  • Some travel may be a requirement for this role (adhering to all restrictions and protocols due to Covid; employee safety comes first).
Education And Experience
  • Post-secondary education in business or related experience
  • 5 – 10 years of experience in Scheduling, Supply Chain, and / or Logistics
  • Logistics experience, specifically in the marine field, is preferred
Irving Oil supports a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants.

Job Requirements - Work Experience

Refinery Operations

Job Requirements - Education

Undergraduate

Location

Saint John, NB

title: Head of Marine Canada
description:
Role Purpose:

Develop and execute the local strategy and proactively support the development of the global strategy for Inland as well as Ocean Marine.

Manage all local LoB portfolio to ensure the successful achievement of the global AGCS LoB targets

Manage all local LoB UW staff

Develop and maintain strong relationships with brokers and clients

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and Manage Underwriting Team

Lead and manage local team, including direct reports and matrix management of functional reports

Manage cost center budget within plan

Underwriting Strategy

Develop and execute local UW strategy for line of business

Support the development of global Underwriting LoB strategy, in line with AGCS CUO

Support the development of cross LoB regional strategy, in line with R&M and Regional CEO

Steering and Controlling

Steer and control local line of business portfolio to drive achievement of financial targets (e.g. full combined ratio)

Drive underwriting planning process and monitor adherence to plan, taking corrective action as necessary

Proactively liaising with functional areas to review performance of end to end Underwriting life cycle

Underwriting Approach and Compliance

Ensure underwriting consistency and underwriting discipline and adherence to all corporate guidelines and authority levels, including Rules and Principles, Underwriting Authorities, corporate governance rules, and local regulatory framework

Referral / case Underwriting of key clients as required

Product Development

Proactively support development and implementation of new and modified products

Proactively support development and implementation of pricing tools

Maintain executive contacts and accompany the Underwriting of all core or strategic accounts

Market & Relationship Management

Proactively support acquisition of new business and retention of existing business (including client and broker negotiations where necessary)

Coordinate with local MMC to drive successful execution of strategic plan

Communicate local LoB strategy externally

Positively represent AGCS internally within the Allianz Group, and externally to the market

Proactively drive involvement of functional areas in Underwriting process, including e.g. MMC, ARC, Claims, Operations

Required Skills:

Master’s Degree, preferably in Economics, Law, or other appropriate discipline

7-10 years of experience and recognized relationship building with brokers at peer group level and well established within local market

Expert understanding of legal and regulatory framework

Significant experience in leadership and development of direct teams internationally and within complex global matrix environments

Analyze current performance against benchmarks applying how the market operates and functions, the business needs and customer needs

Design, develop and implement consistent, robust wordings

Robust understanding of policy administration life cycle, information collection, policy issuance, premium bookings, credit control, cancellation.

Compensation is commensurate with skills and experience and includes a comprehensive best in class benefits package. Any salary or benefits information provided by third party resources such as external job posting websites etc., cannot be deemed reliable.

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.

Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.

For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

title: Marine Scheduler
description:
The Marine Scheduler will join a high performing team and be a key contributor to the success of the Greater Vancouver Aggregates group.  The Lafarge Marine Division provides tug and barge services to internal and external customers in the Greater Vancouver Area.  The primary objectives of this role are to achieve efficiencies of operations and other critical revenue objectives for the market area while ensuring our offering promotes safety, service and value for our customers. 

 

The Marine Scheduler attempts to maximize profitability by optimizing operations, understanding customer requirements, enhancing key customer relationships, and embracing best practice sales and operational management tools and frameworks. 

 

In addition, this role ensures reconciliation and crewing processes are undertaken to allow informed decision making by stakeholders.  This role offers a good mix of safety, operational, customer service, logistics management and labor relations experience and is an exceptional training opportunity for future roles.

 

This role involves occasional after-hours phone calls as operational demand or customer needs arise.

 

Health & Safety:

  • Demonstrates a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to safety policies in all work environment areas.
  • Participates in job observations and toolbox talks.
  • Maintains documentation on safety drills, exercises, tool box talks and training for Lafarge and Transport Canada reporting requirements.
  • Maintain membership on the Joint Health and Safety Committee.

Operations Scheduling:

  • Manage internal and external customer requests and relationships to ensure efficient scheduling while considering overall demands and costs.
  • Proactively communicate with customer site representatives (RMX, Asphalt, Aggregates and External Customers) in order to build optimal schedule. Communicate loading and material movement to all stakeholders.
  • Work closely with other relevant Lafarge product lines (RMX, Asphalt, Aggregates) to ensure there is a consistent and effective offering to the customer and all potential synergies are maximized.
  • Liaise with Customer Service and Logistics Manager and Plant Managers to leverage trucking where applicable to manage overall delivery costs.
  • Manage schedule for key operational vendors including grub delivery, tug cleaning and others. Manage contracts with same and advise when additional vendors are required.
  • Collaborate with team in building solid relationships with key existing and potential customers.

Regulatory Compliance:

  • Monitor and manage compliance with commercial marine regulations such as Transport Canada and Border Services.
  • Complete Customs declarations for deliveries to / from the USA
  • Maintain annual Transport Canada vessel certificates (e.g. bunker, wreck, blue cards)
  • Maintain CBSA carrier code and carrier bond application process

Personnel:

  • Plan crew schedules to meet operational and unionized constraints to ensure customer deliveries are met at lowest possible crew cost
  • Manage the hiring process for all tug crew including maintaining relationships with relevant union Business Agents.
  • Manage labor costs ($3M CAD) and associated balances (vacation, layday liability). Review overtime submissions and provide advice to Senior Manager on trends or issues.
  • Plan layoff schedule and provide guidance to Senior Manager on timing.
  • Maintain strong familiarity with union agreements to help advise and manage employee relations.
  • Manage Annual Orientation training for all tug crew.
  • Maintains certification records for all personnel.
  • Facilitates the processing of HR documentation for all Marine hourly employees.
  • Provide front line advice to crew on HR processes.

Maintenance Scheduling:

  • Work with the Marine Maintenance Manager in collecting and organizing maintenance requests from tug Captains, Engineers and others.
  • Advise Marine Maintenance Manager on issues raised by tug crew and others relating to tugboats, docks or facilities.

Administration:

  • Manage crew payroll process, monitoring lay day dispositions, vacation requests, AR/AP.
  • Maintain and analyze KPI information to drive operational efficiency.
  • Review tug log reports, overtime and grub orders and enter information into KPI and operations tracking tools.
  • Review, propose and create improvements of processes.
  • This role may from time-to-time crossover work with Marine Dispatch as required including:
    • maintaining a live day-to-day Marine operations and work schedule
    • controlling daily operating costs
    • reviewing and analyzing monthly revenue and expenses
    • coordinating assists and shifts through external suppliers and maintain accurate records for cost management purposes
    • reviewing shift, assist, rental invoices for accuracy.

Dimensions:

  • Relationships: Works closely with all Lafarge GVA divisions for material delivery. Works with industry providers to optimize scheduling and costs. Works with boat crews on all operational and HR issues.
  • Three Class II voyage tugs, 9 flat deck barges, 1 auto offloading barge, depot and barge conveyors, four ramp berths, four deport berths, marine division workshop facilities.

Relationships with Other Jobs:

  • Reports to the Senior Manager, Marine Division
  • Daily interaction with Aggregate team (Marine Dispatch, Depot Manager, Territory Managers, Customer Service and Logistics Manager, PRQ Plant Manager)
  • Work closely with the RMX Plant Managers, ASP Plant Managers and external customers
  • Manages ad hoc projects and resources (assigned by Senior Manager or self-directed)

 

Education and Work Experience:

  • Post-Secondary degree in a related field (Business or Logistics) or the equivalent of education and experience.
  • Minimum of 5 - 7 years of logistics (Marine, Aggregate or other) is preferred but not required
  • Demonstrable knowledge about land and/or marine based operations.
  • Aggregate production and barge loading / offloading knowledge is helpful, but not required.

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Leadership, interpersonal and strong communication skills make you an ideal candidate.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment. Good attention to detail.
  • Proven problem solving and analytical skills in a high paced environment.
  • Self-motivated, strong team player.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Works well on teams - demonstrates leadership ability
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proficiency with computer applications (Microsoft, Google business suite)

Job-Specific Competency Profile:

  • Business Acumen
  • Drive for Results
  • Integrity and Trust
  • Intellectual Horsepower
  • Interpersonal Skills
  • Managing and Measuring Work
  • Process Management
  • Computer Skills

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

title: Commercial Diver / Marine Contractor
description:
Company description

True Depth Diving & Marine Service provides Western Canada with professional commercial diving services. Our divers have extensive industry experience; working on projects in Alberta, Saskatchewan, British Columbia, and the Northern Territories. Our team is highly experienced and assist various industries with reservoir maintenance services, underwater construction projects, various topside support, and commercial dive services.

Job description

We are seeking an experienced, certified commercial diver to strengthen our dive teams. The ideal candidate will have excellent underwater construction skills and will be a good communicator with the interest and ability to ensure a safe work environment.

Seeking Responsibilities

  1. Work and cooperate with team supervisor and colleague divers to determine the best underwater methods and strategies as they relate to diving operations.
  2. Perform routine maintenance and service on dive/life support equipment.

Skill/Ability/Knowledge Requirements

1. DCBC Certified Commercial Diver

2. WHIMIS, First Aid, Oxygen Administration, Dive Medical, CSTS 2020

3. Good communicator with strong comprehension of the work required

4. Versatile and willing to pitch in wherever needed to help the team, even if the dive division is slow

5. Team player

6. Good judgment and personal maturity

7. Valid driver’s license and personal transportation

Compensation:

  • Competitive compensation related to ability and experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday, and weekend as may be required
  • On call
  • Weekend availability

License/Certification:

  • Driver's License (Required)

Willingness To Travel:

  • Yes

Work Location:

  • Multiple

Work Remotely:

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, Contract

Salary: $60,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

title: Marine Technician
description:
• Company Summary:
Maple Leaf Marinas is the largest owner of premium Marinas in Canada with locations on Lake Simcoe, Lake Muskoka and Georgian Bay, Ontario. We are the leader in our Industry for providing opportunities for skilled employees in a fast-paced team environment servicing over 3,000 recreational boaters within our portfolio. Our Head Office provides support to the properties and administers supporting functions such as accounting, payroll, marketing, IT, and executive management.
  • Location: Port Severn, Ontario
  • Date Posted: 05 May 2022
  • Closing Date: 30 Jun 2022
  • How to apply:
Please forward resume to Aruta@mlmarinas.com for consideration. Only those candidates chosen for interview will be contacted.
  • Job Type:
  • Job Category:
  • Apply Now: https://mlmarinas.com/career/
Marine Technician (F/T, Permanent Positionwith health benefits & RRSP Matching)

Wauwatosa Marina, Port Severn, Ontario

Qualifications

Marine experience on both gas and diesel engines, marine electronics, and all boat systems including water, electrical systems and related equipment.

5+ years of industry experience.

Skills

Superior customer service skills with strong attention to detail, good analytical and problem-solving skills. Individual must be self-directed, possess good time management, organizational and solid repair skills. Strong written, verbal and communication skills an asset. Ability to work independently and multi-task easily.

Specific Skills
  • Repair Boats and Motors
  • Adjust, repair or replace mechanical or electrical system parts
  • Perform scheduled maintenance and service
  • Review work orders and discuss work with Supervisor
  • Test and adjust repaired equipment for proper performance
  • Adjust, repair or replace parts using hand tools and equipment
  • Other duties as required.
Personal Suitability

Must Be PUNCTUAL, DEPENDABLE, RELIABLE, Flexible, Judgment, Accurate, Organized and a Team Player

title: Hydrographer - Marine
description:
The Hydrographer is responsible for conducting Hydrographic surveys in accordance with project requirements and company procedures via the direction of a Lead Hydrographer or Project Manager. Will perform and/or supervise

the installation and calibration, if applicable, of any and all survey equipment required for a particular project. Will operate all applicable equipment utilized on a project. Will perform data processing, charting and reporting of

collected data into the deliverables required. Will be responsible for the quality control of the collected data at time of acquisition, during processing and subsequent creation of deliverables.

Job Responsibilities
  • Configure and operate data acquisition and data processing software, including but not limited to WinFrog, Qinsy, Qimera, FMGT, CARIS, Global Mapper, and POSPac.
  • Configure and operate data acquisition and data processing hardware, including but not limited to Single and Multibeam echosounder systems, Side Scan Sonar, POS M/V (A/V), PCs, velocimeters, tide gauges, winches, LiDAR systems.
  • Monitor data quality during acquisition and processing efforts and keep the Supervisor Manager advised of any issues requiring additional assistance.
  • Responsible for logs and record keeping.
  • Maintain accurate version control of all data and/or deliverables.
  • Responsible for survey specific calibrations including but not limited to single and multibeam echosounders, motion reference units and gyros, utilizing Fugro procedures, client requirements and/or best practice.
  • Assist with or plan project operations for the safest approach with maximum efficiency utilizing given assets.
  • Assist with or complete, if applicable, the Daily Progress Report, for submittal to the Project Manager each day during field operations.
  • Assist with the coordination of logistics, spares or replacements of equipment as well as consumable when required.
  • Track and direct backup of all raw and processed data complete with logs.

Job Requirements
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States, without restrictions.
  • Must have a driver’s license with an acceptable motor vehicle record.
  • Possess the ability to obtain a valid passport for international travel
  • Posses a BS/BA in Survey/Geomatic Engineering or related field
  • Have 1 or more years’ experience conducting hydrographic
  • surveys, including some multi-beam experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Ability to spot irregularities and data quality issues during the data acquisition process.
  • Have MS Word, Excel, and Access; Internet software, E-mail; Windows operating systems; Geographic
  • conversion software, ArcGIS/ArcPro, AutoCAD, MicroStation experience
  • Knowledge of hydrographic data analytical tools (e.g. Caris, HIPS/SIPS)
  • Knowledge of procedures for enabling StarFix GPS service and conducting confidence checks

Disclaimer For Recruitment Agencies

Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated.

title: INGÉNIEUR SYSTÈME/PROJET – SIMULATION ET SYSTÈMES NAVALS
description:
The Hydrographer is responsible for conducting Hydrographic surveys in accordance with project requirements and company procedures via the direction of a Lead Hydrographer or Project Manager. Will perform and/or supervise

the installation and calibration, if applicable, of any and all survey equipment required for a particular project. Will operate all applicable equipment utilized on a project. Will perform data processing, charting and reporting of

collected data into the deliverables required. Will be responsible for the quality control of the collected data at time of acquisition, during processing and subsequent creation of deliverables.

Job Responsibilities
  • Configure and operate data acquisition and data processing software, including but not limited to WinFrog, Qinsy, Qimera, FMGT, CARIS, Global Mapper, and POSPac.
  • Configure and operate data acquisition and data processing hardware, including but not limited to Single and Multibeam echosounder systems, Side Scan Sonar, POS M/V (A/V), PCs, velocimeters, tide gauges, winches, LiDAR systems.
  • Monitor data quality during acquisition and processing efforts and keep the Supervisor Manager advised of any issues requiring additional assistance.
  • Responsible for logs and record keeping.
  • Maintain accurate version control of all data and/or deliverables.
  • Responsible for survey specific calibrations including but not limited to single and multibeam echosounders, motion reference units and gyros, utilizing Fugro procedures, client requirements and/or best practice.
  • Assist with or plan project operations for the safest approach with maximum efficiency utilizing given assets.
  • Assist with or complete, if applicable, the Daily Progress Report, for submittal to the Project Manager each day during field operations.
  • Assist with the coordination of logistics, spares or replacements of equipment as well as consumable when required.
  • Track and direct backup of all raw and processed data complete with logs.

Job Requirements
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States, without restrictions.
  • Must have a driver’s license with an acceptable motor vehicle record.
  • Possess the ability to obtain a valid passport for international travel
  • Posses a BS/BA in Survey/Geomatic Engineering or related field
  • Have 1 or more years’ experience conducting hydrographic
  • surveys, including some multi-beam experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Ability to spot irregularities and data quality issues during the data acquisition process.

  • conversion software, ArcGIS/ArcPro, AutoCAD, MicroStation experience
  • Knowledge of hydrographic data analytical tools (e.g. Caris, HIPS/SIPS)
  • Knowledge of procedures for enabling StarFix GPS service and conducting confidence checks
